title: What's your favorite Chinese song? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have two. I'm not majoring in Music, so I don't know any reason why they are so good, I only know I love them. 十年（shi nian, Ten Years)  I knew Eason because of this song. And this is also my first song I learnt to sing. I'm always a tone-deaf. Since I was 6 years old, my classmates laught at my singing, I quit singing, that was not my thing. When I was a freshman in Highschool, about 7 years ago, lots of my friends wanted to hold a party for my birthday. As a poor student, I really did not know or dare to throw a party. So I refused. They probably found out why, so they said we can go Dutch, my friend would pay most of the fees. And KTV is one of the parts of my party. I was scared, I told them I was suck in singing, they said it was OK, KTV was fun! And I, as the protagonist, I also had to sing one song. I could not refuse. Then one of my friends, we call him Big Cow, said he could teach me a song. So here it is, the song was “十年”，we practiced it in the dormitory in the noon, actually it was fun! Even now I can still remember the details of that noon. We just sang or yelled together, released ourselves, tried to be a real me! Then in the afternoon class, my classmates told me there were two dorks sang in the whole noon, which is usually the rest time. And the second day, the whold school knew the two dorks were us. But, I did not even care! Hahah I just found out how cool I was, with my friends! And the school also just smiled to us. After graduation, we went to different cites. And I miss you guys. This song represents my youth my friendship. 默( mo, Silence)  It was at nightfall, two years ago, I was dumped by my girlfriend. Actually she has never admitted me as her boyfriend. I was so sad, I thought she was my only solemate. In the way to my dormitory, the school’s broadcast played this song. My soul was shakened, the feeling was so amazing, it was like my soul trembled with the rhythm. I just sit under the broadcast to enjoy the song, everything can be OK! This song is my immature view of relationship and intimacy. I'm not saying the songs are memorable only because of the stories, in fact, without the beauty of these songs, my stories are not compelete.

I’m a British guy who studies traditional Chinese music. I might not be the best person to ask because I didn’t grow up with modern pop Chinese music, nor is it the center of my research. That being said, I do like plenty of songs and I have studied it before. Here are some of my favourite examples then. Let’s start with some oldies before we get to the more recent stuff. If you’re into vintage things, then it’s worth knowing about Zhou Xuan, the main pop star of 30s Shanghai:  Zhou Xuan, 花好月圓  Zhou Xuan, 天涯歌女  Now let’s move onto things your parents will remember if they’re Chinese. Throughout the 70s and 80s, Taiwan and Hong Kong dominated the music market. So here’s some good old Teresa Teng (Taiwan) relaxing your soul and Alan Tam (Hong Kong).  Teresa Teng, 甜蜜蜜  Alan Tam, 愛的根源  Moving onto the 90s, we briefly get the rock scene, spearheaded by none other than Cui Jian. I know to people who know about Chinese music I couldn’t have picked a more ‘standard’ song here, but it’s a classic and I like it. There is also the great band from Hong Kong called Beyond, and the more recent rock star Wang Feng:  Cui Jian, 一無所有  Beyond, 光輝歲月  Wang Feng, 北京北京  From the 90s onwards, Chinese popular music has kind of morphed into a general ‘pop’ sound. I guess this might be the part you’ve come for, so here are some of my favourite more recent Chinese ‘pop’ songs (note that to dedicated fans many of these are a bit ‘older’, but come on, I study Chinese traditional music, anything before 100 years is still young to me haha!):  Kit Chan, 心動  Liu Xijun, 我很快樂  Liu Xijun, 有你在身邊  Leehom Wang, 花田錯  Ai Jing, 我的1997  Eason Chan, 無條件 And now stand up for the king of Chinese pop, Jay Chou:  Jay Chou, 聽見下雨的聲音  Jay Chou, 青花瓷  Jay Chou, 龙卷风  Finally, whilst China’s hip-hop appreciation isn’t huge, there are some good examples of Chinese hip hop I would like to share:  LMF, 圍威喂  LMF, 1127  Double J, It’s Ok  Namewee, 漂向北方
